description: Numbers n with property that n cycles to itself after sufficiently many iterations of "reverse decimal digits of (n+4)".
comments: Sequence is probably finite and the list of 54 integers shown is probably complete (all integers <= 10000 eventually iterate to a cycle based on these 54, although for example 111 takes 2635 iterations to do so via a maximum of 99889)An equivalent conjecture is that all numbers converge to the trajectory of 1 shown in A119031. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 02 2009.
references: J. Roberts, Lure of the Integers, Math. Assoc. America, 1992, p. 15.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 30 2000
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 02 2009
Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 04 2010
